title: Nicole Kidman dedicates her part in Lion to adopted kids | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 27 shares Speaking to The Mirror, the actress revealed she is supportive of children wishing to find their birth parents, adding: 'It's not about anything other than saying, 'I wanted you and whatever your journey is, I'm here to love and support you'. That's what I connected to.' 'When you are an adoptive mother, of course you think about the birth mother and the birth parents and what it all means and how our lives are intertwined, whether the child chooses to find the birth parents or not,' she added. 'I wanted you and whatever your journey is': Speaking about her role in the hard-hitting film, the Australian actress, 49, dedicated it to her adopted children Connor and Isabella (pictured in 2004) Nicole adopted children Connor and Isabella in 1992 and 1995 respectively, with Tom Cruise who she was married to for 11 years from 1990. Nicole and Tom divorced in 2001, and retained shared custody of the youngsters. With Tom, 54- who is also father to Suri with ex-wife Katie Holmes, is a devout Scientologist and both Connor and Isabella were raised in the religion. However Nicole re-embraced her Catholicism, and revealed in 2007 that her children Connor, now 22, and Isabella, 24, call her by her name. 'My kids don't call me mommy, they don't even call me mom. 'They call me Nicole, which I hate and tell them off for it,' she said at the time. In September 2015 Isabella married an IT consultant- a ceremony both parents were absent from, before settling down in London's suburb of Croydon- which houses a large Scientology centre. 'When you are an adoptive mother, of course you think about the birth mother and the birth parents and what it all means and how our lives are intertwined', Nicole said Speaking about her relationship with her parents in March 2016, she slammed rumours of a rift, telling New Idea: 'Of course we talk, they're my parents', adding, anyone who says otherwise is 'full of s**t.' Croydon is worlds away from smart London pad Bella lived in London with her father paying her rent, and Tom's rambling Los Angeles mansion after he split from second wife Nicole. Woman's Day previously reported that Nicole has been concerned for her daughter's new home, in an area which has a reputation for high crime. The publication stated at the time: 'Nicole was thrilled by news of Bella's nuptials, despite wishing she could have attended but she is said to be worried about her adoptive daughter's residence in one of London's least desirable suburbs.' The success of Lion: The critically-acclaimed film has already bagged a host of nominations at both the BAFTAs and the Academy Awards Critically-acclaimed film Lion has already bagged a host of nominations at both the BAFTAs and the Academy Awards. Nicole was nominated for her role as adoptive Tasmanian mum Sue Brierley at both the British awards and Oscars in the Best Supporting Actress category. Lion's lead actor Dev Patel also won critical acclaim for his performance as the Australian raised Saroo, winning himself a BAFTA award for Best Supporting Actor. Meanwhile Nicole married singer Keith Urban during a lavish Sydney wedding in 2006, and they share two children Sunday Rose, 8, and Faith Margaret, 5.
